channel.title: How do we put custom items in their true spot (look)
channel.description:
wat i mean is that i got.. some custom items but they go into the weapon slot.. i wanna change it so it goes into the platebody spot
thanks in advanced

item.title: How do we put custom items in their true spot (look)
item.dc:creator: @ztr_zac1 ztr zac
item.description:
@ztr_zac1 wrote:

[quote=“killer numba 1, post:5, topic:220203”]No i think what hes looking for is the right slot possition.
Item.java would be for coding in the Id’s so you can see them perfectly without glitches.
Item4 is what your looking for. Open that and place the id’s in the right section. Capes goes in Cape() obviously.

Good luck[/quote]

No… Item.cfg is the codes and bonuses(codes are actually client sided but code recognition for shops and so on is in item .cfg). Item.java contains all the “public static int capes[]” and so on. Lets say you wanted to add strength cape into the right equipment slot, you would find the public static int capes and add the strength cape id into the array

Read full topic
item.source: How do we put custom items in their true spot (look)

item.title: How do we put custom items in their true spot (look)
item.dc:creator: @killer_numba_1 killer numba 1
item.description:
@killer_numba_1 wrote:

No i think what hes looking for is the right slot possition.
Item.java would be for coding in the Id’s so you can see them perfectly without glitches.
Item4 is what your looking for. Open that and place the id’s in the right section. Capes goes in Cape() obviously.

Good luck

Read full topic
item.source: How do we put custom items in their true spot (look)

item.title: How do we put custom items in their true spot (look)
item.dc:creator: @Mosh_On Mosh_On
item.description:
@Mosh_On wrote:

item.java

put the item ID in the correct Category

EG capes go in the Capes category

Hope this helped
